fields.description:
TortoiseSVN allows doing commits across working copies. I used that quite a lot because some of our projects span multiple repositories. For example in one project the frontend and backend code is separate, but in periods we need to do development in both. In TortoiseSVN I could select both working copies (in Windows Explorer), select commit, type a message, and hit go. It would then do a commit with the same message for all selected working copies.

The other great thing about that is that I'm able to see all the changes I've done across working copies.

In SourceTree I have to perform one commit per repository I have touched, usually having to copy the commit message since it's often the same. Additionally I have to jump between repository tabs to figure out what exactly I have changed everywhere. 

Don't know how easy it is to fix?

h3. My suggested solution

- Current bookmark side panel supports creating folders for repositories.
- Allow opening up a folder as a tab
- The tab should show a merged view of at least File Status (not sure how easy it is to show a merged view of File History?)
- The tab should allow committing cross repositories. I.e. do one commit to each affected repository with the same message
fields.summary: Allow doing commits and view file status across repositories

fields.description:
If you have a local branch that tracks a remote branch, and they are of different names, when you push, a new branch will be created instead of pushing to the tracked branch.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a remote branch {{upper/lower123}}.
# Check out this branch in SourceTree as {{upper/lower}}.
# Make a commit.
# Push from local branch {{upper/lower}} to remote branch {{upper/lower123}}. If you check the remote, a new branch called {{upper/lower}} is created.
fields.summary: Pushing Tracking Branches with a Different Name Creates a New Branch

fields.description: On staging view the item on Staged/Unstaged or not appearing ordered, make the user to search in a large list of items for the items changed on a specific folder that is out of place.
fields.summary: Order on Staged/Unstaged

fields.description:
When I try to perform an interactive rebase on a series of commits, if I squash together commits and check amend comit (or don't) that require a merge to fix conflicts, then it fails every time (which it should), but when I hit close the whole thing aborts and cancels the rebase, instead of letting me perform the needed changes

I can manually perform the rebase if I start it from sorucetree but don't hit close after it first fails. However, that's through the terminal, and just a workaround, and will not be accepted by the rest of my team.

We are planning to use this for a workflow with pullrequests and merging the code review changes together with a squash/fixup, without this we can't do use the GUI for everything.

I can reproduce this locally with a virtually trivial merge... take a code file, add 3-4 commits in a row to a branch each only adding an additional adjacent linefeed. This forces a merge and the above described problem.

I was told this was fixed for 1.6:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1880

However that does not appear to be the case.

I have a question on answers as well:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/10392524/comments/10392756
fields.summary: Interactively rebase always aborting when a merge is necessary

fields.description: According to here: http://makandracards.com/makandra/13725-git-how-to-stash-with-a-custom-message it is possible to include an extended description in git stashes. This would be useful to have in SourceTree to make it easy to keep tabs on the purpose of specific stashes.
fields.summary: Users should be allowed to save comments with stashes

fields.description:
Hello,

Our mercurial server is using un auto-signed SSL certificate on the HTTPS part.

Currently, it's not possible to by-pass an invalid SSL certificate.

In mercurial, it's possible on the command line : hg clone --insecure

Regards.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Open a repository hosted on GitHub
* Click the checkbox next to an unstaged file to stage it

Expected results:
* File is staged quickly.

Actual results:
* A spinning progress indicator appears for 5-15 seconds.  Larger files take longer to stage.

Steps to reproduce crashes:

* Open a repository hosted on GitHub
* Make sure the repository has multiple files unstaged
* Click files rapidly to stage and unstage

Expected results:
* Files are staged and unstaged correctly as per the checkboxes

Actual results:
* First few files are staged; SourceTree then crashes
fields.summary: File Staging window is slow and crashes
Leading Space in %HOME% Causes SourceTree to Crash

fields.description:
*How to reproduce*
# Create remote branch
# Validate it is shown in 'Remotes' section of Repo tab
# Remove it from another machine
# Run 'Refresh Remote Status' using menu or hot keys
# Check 'Remotes' section of Repo tab

*Expected result*
Brach removed.

*Actual result*
It is still present in list of remotes branches.

*Workaround*
Open git console and run
{code}
git remote update --prune origin
{code}
After this command executed list of remote branches in SourceTree gets updated.
fields.summary: Git: Remote branches list does not update properly

fields.description:
Hi,

It appears that Sourctree doesn't remember the setting for the file viewer. I screen captured the look as I set it in the SourcetreeSettings.png

Every time Sourcetree is restarted, it goes back to "Modified files,sorted by file status". (See what happens in Sourcetree after restart.png) It also doesn't move the tab bar to the position of the opened repo. So, although the right repo is opened after a restart, you have to move the tab bar to find which repo is shown.

A more annoying issue is resetting the settings after changing the tabs from one repo to the other and coming back to the same repo. After changing tabs, the file viewer will again move the vertical splitter to the middle (tile settings are gone). (See this in sourcetree after chaning tabs.png) It also doesn't remember which file was selected to show and jumps back to the first file in the list.

It would be best to have sourcetree remember these settings. Also, please change the default setting to split the screen based on the filename lengths at least. When filenames are short it is basically wasting the space by setting the splitter to the middle.
fields.summary: fileview window settings

fields.description:
When clicking Create Patch or Discard and selecting files it will say:

Please select at least one file to patch|discard.

Making patches is next to impossible and discarding selectively can only be done right clicking from the commit window.

This has been in for months and getting ridiculous that this isn't fixed yet, this is be a blocker and picked up first.
fields.summary: Patch AND discard broken

fields.description:
SourceTree does not allow to commit if a rebase is in progress.
I understand the need to show a warning, but not allowing commit at all prevents a number of useful functionalities related to git interactive rebase:
- amending a commit (to change the content or the commit message)
- splitting one commit into one or more commits
- probably others.

Please allow comitting during rebase.
The warning dialog should have one more button: "Commit anyway"
fields.summary: should allow commit during rebase

fields.description: Clicking on list of files either in Staged or Unstaged file list causes Sourcetree to crash
fields.summary: Clicking on Staged or Unstaged file list causes Sourcetree to crash

fields.description: When the "Unstaged files" list has a vertical scroll bar, dragging the scroll bar doesn't make any change to the view until the scroll bar has moved down by a whole item. It is rounding off the scroll position so that a whole item is always at the top of the view. I don't like it, especially with the large size of each row. Can you please make this list view scroll per-pixel instead of per-item.
fields.summary: Jumpy scrolling of "Unstaged files"

fields.description: When the "Unstaged files" list has a vertical scroll bar, dragging the scroll bar doesn't make any change to the view until the scroll bar has moved down by a whole item. fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create more than 1000 repositories in Stash
# Add Stash server into SourceTree Hosted Account List
# Check SourceTree Hosted Repositories
It will load non-stop and only 1000 repositories listed. Stash log file showing that SourceTree is trying to get Stash repositories list repeatedly through REST API
# Close the SourceTree Hosted Repositories window
Stash log file still showing that SourceTree is trying to get Stash repositories list repeatedly
# Close SourceTree application
It will not get Stash Repositories through REST API anymore

having the Hosted Repositories loading non-stop (REST API repeatedly for more than 1000 repos) will cause Performance issue in Stash server
fields.summary: Hosted Repositories load non-stop if remote server has more than 1000 repos

fields.description:
In {{Hosted Repositories}}, repositories followed by a user in BitBucket are not showing up. This appears to have been removed in 1.6 and later.

Steps to reproduce:
# Follow a repository in BitBucket.
# View the {{Hosted Repositories}} window in SourceTree.
fields.summary: Hosted Repositories Not Showing Repositories Followed in BitBucket

fields.description:
The current behavior when finishing a feature/release/hotfix and merging the commit message defaults to "Merge branch x into y".
To change this commit message one has to amend the last commit message which can be done with some clicks which seem to be unnecessary extra steps.
Adding a commit message text box in the finish feature/release/hotfix dialog would improve usability of the gitflow GUI.
fields.summary: Git flow custom commit message on finishing feature/release/etc

fields.description:
All of a sudden sourcetree would crash as I start it, no error message at all. I dis-installed it, removed the local user folder and installed it again.
Now it starts correctly, but as I click on the "hosted repositories" button or Tools>Options>Authentication it would crash again. 
Attached the log file.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes no matter what, probably authentication problem

fields.description:
The upgrade of SourceTree 1.6 in the past few months changed the way the stage/unstage screen looks. In the past it was intuitive. It contained the unstaged files in the lower section and the staged files in the upper section. If files needed to be staged, you'd select them and click the single arrow that points towards the stage screen. If all files needed to be staged, you'd click the double arrow that point towards the stage screen. The same mechanism for unstaging files. Everybody seemed to understand this right from the start. At least in our team.

Then with the upgrade to 1.6 this was changed to having checkmarks. Marking a single file immediately stages it. Marking the parent checkbox, stages all unstaged files. This is very counter intuitive. Nobody in our team understand why this was done. Checkmarks are typically used for preselecting items, with which you want to do an action later on.

So in short: It would be great if SourceTree would have the old staging screen again. Not only was there, from our point of view, no reason to change it, it was also more user friendly and intuitive than the one that is currently in place.

The discussion below the release notes of 1.6 sum this up quite nicely. See the comment from Iain Farrell: http://blog.sourcetreeapp.com/2014/08/19/sourcetree-for-windows-1-6-now-available/
fields.summary: Change stage/unstage screen back to how it was pre-1.6

fields.description: Now it is possible to create bookmark(s) on existing project(s) by DND. But if I try to DND parent folder the source tree does nothing. I think it should scan the folder and create bookmarks for all repositories in subfolders along with recreation folder structure in bookmark tree (optional)
fields.summary: DND the folder structure should import the repositories along with reflecting folder structure

fields.description: After resolving conflicts during a rebase is is not obvious for a newbie how to continue.  Adding a big "continue rebase" button on the screen would make it clearer.
fields.summary: Add a big "continue rebase" button on the screen after resolving conflicts.

fields.description: I've committed file via Mac OS X which has "|" (pipe) in the name. I've added the working directory to SourceTree but it keeps crashing. Had to fix the issue via command-line.
fields.summary: Checking out bad filenames on windows crashes SourceTree

fields.description:
I'm doing work in VMs for each client.

Every now and then, I need to do some work for a client for which work hasn't been done in a long while, so I:
- open the VM
- update it to the latests Windows patches and tools updates

In this case the VM has SourceTree 1.2.3 on it, which when checking for updates happily indicates

{code}
    [Checking for updates]
    Your software is up to date
    [OK]
{code}

In the background it downloads http://www.sourcetreeapp.com/update/windowsupdates.txt

so it looks the format of that file is now changed to something 1.2.3 cannot interpret any more.
fields.summary: Update mechanism is broken for SourceTree 1.2.3

fields.description:
This might also be called, "Why does SourceTree think there's a Kieran user on my box?"

Was cloning this project:
https://github.com/lextm/sharpsnmplib

it finished.  Closed full console output of successful clone. BAM. Told to include log and report bug.  Have cut log down to today's errors.

Stack trace includes lines like...

at SourceTree.AppRoot.GetPrioritySchedulerForRepository(Repository repo) in c:\Users\Kieran\Documents\Development\sourcetreewin\AppRoot.cs:line 429

Thought that was a little odd.  I appreciate his work, but Kieran does not have an account on my machine.
fields.summary: Unexpected crash after cloning a new repo

fields.description: After selecting Commit, when you are adding files to version control the dialog box appears with the text "These files will be added to version control." This list will run off of the screen if you are adding many files at one time. I have found that pressing the enter key will let you proceed but you cannot see the buttons at the bottom of the box or any files that are down there.
fields.summary: Dialog box runs off of screen

fields.description:
The behavior of the checkboxes next to the list of staged/unstaged files is rather confusing.  Typically a checkbox is used to indicate the status of a users selection.  As such, I do not expect that it immediately trigger an action.  Rather it should be used as part of a two step process where a user selects an item (or items) and then choose an action to take on the selected items.

Since upgrading to 1.6.x I frequently find myself (mistakenly) selecting the checkbox next to an unstaged file intending to select a list of files to apply a the same action to each.  Every time I do this I'm frustrated to see the selected file immediately moved to the staged files list.  The expected behavior (select multiple items to perform an action upon) is only possible by shift-clicking the files desired, then selecting an action from the right-click context menu.

I found the arrows in 1.5.x to be far less confusing than the current checkbox based UI.  

Please consider making the checkboxes behave properly as a selection control or change to another control (perhaps the arrows from 1.5.x)
fields.summary: Checkbox behavior is confusing

fields.description:
How to reproduce:
1. Clone a repository with more than one branch
2. Check out a remote branch
SourceTree crashes.

After restarting SourceTree, the branch can be checked out just fine.
fields.summary: Crash when checking out branch immediately after cloning repo

I switched to ST and saw nothing in the uncommitted section. Switched back to WS and closed all tabs. Switched back to ST and still nothing. Started clicking origin and then master and crash.
Looks like the log has a few crash stack traces too. (the latest st has crashed a few times).

Thanks for this awesome product!

fields.description:

fields.description:
I use pageant not only with SourceTree, so it's usually started before the start of SourceTree. Then SSH key is not being added to pageant upon SourceTree start.

Steps to reproduce:

# *Preconditions:*
In _Options_ - > _General_ tab -> frame entitled _SSH Client Configuration_, set following options:
#* _SSH Key_: {{path to the key file}}
#* _SSH Client_: {{PuTTY / Plink}}
#* (/) _Automatically start SSH agent when SourceTree opens_
# Exit from SourceTree.
# Run Pageant without adding the key defined in SourceTree options.
# Run SourceTree.

In my opinion, defined SSH key should be added exactly like when above procedure would be repeated without 3rd step.

I've checked it and calling pageant (even from another location than pageant which is already running) with path to key file as a parameter, adds the key to already running instance.
fields.summary: SSH Key is not opened when Pageant started before SourceTree

fields.description: Please update {{putty}} version attached to the application under {{tools}}. Included version is 0.62 and the latest version (fixing some *security holes*) is 0.63.
fields.summary: Update putty version included in installation

fields.description: Don` t start
fields.summary: Don` t start

fields.description:
We use an automatic ID-String in our source files.
Something like this:
   $id = "filename.cpp 123 $author $last_commit_date"

The string has to be updated every time a user changes the file and commits the changes.

To automate this change we use a standalone tool which is called every time a file is included in a commit right before the commit action.

if we use sourcetree with git-flow support the files are committed several times (feature branch, develop, ...). Therefore the git-indent filter is called several times and so the file is changed right after the first commit again and so this method does not work anymore.

Feature-Request: 
Please provide a method to run a script if someone presses the COMMIT button (the LAST one after entering the commit message). Something like "run_script(REPO-BASE-DIR)"

The REPO-BASE-DIR is the base-directory of the repository the commit is run on.  Then we can first modify the files included in the commit and then the normal action takes place.
fields.summary: run user-defined scripts on button click

fields.description: App crashed after I try to staged files (clean code igniter files)

The icon in the start menu continues to work.

fields.description:
When performing a fetch, sometimes tracking branches no longer present on remote(s) are not pruned despite the user selecting to do so.  Prioritized initially as major due to this causing team members to inadvertently necro and build upon intentionally removed branches.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Perform a fetch using the Fetch icon on the main/top button bar
2) Check all 3 boxes
3) Observe that a branch which is known to have been removed from the remote still appears under the remote tracking branches within SourceTree.

Solution:
--prune does not invoke pruning of tracking branches when used at the same time as --tags.  Fetch new tags and prune branches via separate commands unless some other arrangement of flags provides the intended result.  When not selecting the checkbox to fetch new tags, the prune appears to work.  Note: perhaps preserving the prior 'fetch all tags' checkbox state between calls may now be possible without causing issues.
fields.summary: Prune tracking branches - problem and solution

fields.description:
Occasional auto selection of "Push changes immediately" in Commit View even though "Push to default/origin remote when committing" is unselected.

Which is a) super annoying & b) really messes history up when you aren't allowed to rewrite history on remote
fields.summary: Occasional auto selection of "Push changes immediately"

fields.description: Had just pushed old repo to stash, was looking at the remote/origin branches, clicking around. Changed which branches to show at one point then back to all. Was clicking on a specific branch when it crashed and was embarrassed.
fields.summary: Crashed while viewing remote branches graphically

fields.description:
The installed SourceTree program seems to follow the language of the operating system, on windows.
I'd like to use the English version instead of the Italian but I can't find how to change it.
The translation in local language can be useful for someone, but is not a good choice for developers that use to code with English tools.
Either give the possibility to change the language, or, at least let put the question in the installer program.

This issue did not happen on mac os.
fields.summary: The language of SourceTree should be choosen by the user at install, not by the system automatically

fields.description:
Crash on importing an existing git repository:
I select clone/new and after i selected the path on my hd of an existing repo, ST crashed.
When I restarted ST however I can see the repo as imported.

THE VERSION reported is 1.6.7.0 !!!
fields.summary: Crash on importing an existing git repository

fields.description:
The date showed is wrong, it seems that the date format paramented has been translated into Italian.
I shows:

 d.C. ott aaaa 15:35

instead of:

23/ott/2014 15:35
fields.summary: On Italian version the Date colums shows wrong data

fields.description:
I have a password of 38 characters. (I use a password manager...)

SourceTree could not authenticate against our Active Directory, while our installation of Stash worked fine.
fields.summary: Long passwords do not authenticate against Active Directory
Crash on closing the repo fold

fields.description:
When using the {{Check default remotes for updates every X minutes}} option, when a refresh happens, the current UI gets reset, even though a user may be looking through a file list, or file diff. 

The UI should remain the same after a refresh, especially if there is no actual changes on the remotes.
fields.summary: Retain UI State When Refreshing Remotes
Crash

fields.description:
As a SourceTree user, I want 'Uncommitted changes' to be automatically selected in the 'Log / History' view if it exists and there have been changes.

When I click the 'Log / History' tab and there are uncommitted changes since I was last here, 'Uncommitted Changes' is selected.

When I focus on SourceTree with the 'Log / History' tab open and new changes are detected, the 'Uncommitted Changes' node at the top is selected.

When I select a different change node and no new changes have occurred, my selected node doesn't change.

When I click the 'Log / History' tab and there have not been uncommitted changes since I was last here, the previously selected change node remains selected.

NOTE: I prefer to use the Log / History view by default, but often the first thing I do when I go to SourceTree is to check in changes I just made. Every time I do, I need to first select the 'Uncommitted changes' node at the top. It would be wonderful if I could have this selected automatically.
fields.summary: Auto-select 'Uncommitted changes' node in Log/History when new changes are detected

fields.summary: Selected two items and selected commit, then the app crashed

fields.description: Even if I choose a destination folder where I have write access, the installer asks for administrator rights. I don't have an admin account on my computer and I cannot install SourceTree.
fields.summary: Install SourceTree for Windows without admin rights

fields.description:
Windows 8.1 Pro

When I close the Source Tree incorrectly (by mistake, forcing the process or because the computer crashed ) it loses my project list (left-hand column).
fields.summary: To close the Source Tree lose my list of projects

fields.description: Would be really nice to have filter in repositories. So if filter is entered  then sourcetree should show repositories which contains filter phrase.
fields.summary: Filter for repositories

fields.description:
I have a directory mounted as a drive via the subst command. I try to install SourceTree to the default location (C:\Program Files...). After clicking "Install" and being asked for admin permissions, the installer pauses shortly,  and a message pops up "Invalid Drive: E:\")

The mounted directory does not lie on the same HDD as C:, so it should not really interfere.
fields.summary: Cannot install on machine with mounted drive (subst command)

fields.description: some files were staged ready to commit. I checked a .ldf file in staged files list to unstage it. ST crashes indicating there was a permission denied error.
fields.summary: ST crashes when trying to perform operation on locked file

fields.description: Starting a commit without the ssh agent and/or the ssh key loaded leaves the commit dialog effectively spinning forever
fields.summary: There is no indication that the SSH agent is not running when doing a commit.

fields.description: when I click on a file to add it so I can commit I receive a screen error pointing me to submit the bug on your website. Now I cannot do anything, I cannot push the files. I use the latest version 1.6.5.0, I updated today. The old version was working just fine. Vic
fields.summary: when I click on a file to add it so I can commit I receive a screen error

fields.description: When running "git rebase" at the command-line it shows progress in terms of the number of lines in the rebase TODO that it has processed. It would be nice if SourceTree could show a determinate progress bar when executing or continuing a rebase.
fields.summary: Show determinate progress bar while rebase is running

This was the last part in the log: upwards was only stuff that was there days before.

fields.summary: Crash with Message Popup

fields.description:
When there are Git conflicts with many files and I try to scroll staging files list, User interface freezes.

So I need to solve conflicts with external program/command line to use SourceTree again for the repository.

Same goes with conflicts made with SourceTree and loading repository with old git conflicts.

I have attached:
* picture where problem is pointed out
* example of repository (it should be easy to reproduce just opening that repository while keeping SourceTree window not maximized)
* All steps recorded with Win8 Steps recorder.

This problem stared with a few new versions (I think with new GUI interface).
Where I could download other/older versions of SourceTree (if you would not be able to reproduce/correct it faster)
fields.summary: GUI Freeze, when scrooling staged files with conflicts

fields.description:
Trying to clone from a bare, GIT-flow enabled repository "origin" everyone here gets that error message (see "Error" attachment). Happens if we use the same network-drive, as shown in the screenshot.

We found that it works the moment we choose different network drive letters at source and destination path textboxes (see "workaround" attachment). Order doesn't matter, we could swap these paths and it would still work.

Please note that technically drive "P:\" and "F:\SOFTDEV\" is the very same directory. "P:\" is only a shortcut using those windows network drives...
fields.summary: Clone Repository fails if source and destination path use the same drive letter

fields.description:
Actually version is 1.6.5 but I don't know why here is displayed as unreleased.. This is offered as update to me in some previous version but I don't know why this version is not listed as released. When one download SourceTree from http://www.sourcetreeapp.com/ at the moment version 1.6.5 is downloaded.

I have 2 files ready for commit and several more changed that I wanted to commit later-separately. When I clicked commit from toolbar SourceTree crashed completely.
fields.summary: Crash on commit 2 files

fields.description: When SourceTree fails to register due to a too small password, there is a unable to connect message
fields.summary: Improve Messages for Registration Errors due to password

fields.description: When viewing the diff of a file, when there are a lot of changes that are included in a single hunk, the horizontal scroll bar isn't visible until you've scrolled to the bottom of the hunk.
fields.summary: Horizontal scroll bar not visible for long hunks.

fields.description:
In "File Status" and "Log / History" tabs, the list "Working Copy Changes" is populated with all files in the git repo, each file marked as "unchanged". Even changed files are in the list and marked as unchanged. Files are not changed, no "tab/space" switches, no changes of new line character(s) etc.

I have tried to remove my local repo entirely, remove the bookmark in SourceTree and clone the repo again, but the error persists..

This is a non working scenario:
* See attached Screenshot1.png
* I have one file changed,still not on stage.
* File Status and Log / History, the list "Working Copy Changes" is populated with a lot of incorrect files marked as unmodified. The one file that is actually changed is also present in the list but marked as "unmodified" instead of changed. I think that it may be ALL the tracked files in my repo (not the files in gitignore)
* The list Staged Changes is empty
* If I press Stage All here,no visual updates are done. All files remains in the lower box "Working Copy Changes". But the single file is actually moved to stage (verified with "git status" on command line).
* If I now press "double arrow down" (that miss quick tip text),the single file is NOT removed from stage.
* The list Working Copy Changes is still populated with all files in my repo, all marked as "unmodified".

This is a working scenario:
* See attached Screenshot2.png
* I have one file changed,still not on stage.
* If I run "git status",I have one modified file no and no changes added to commit
* If I press Commit button in SourceTree, I get the change file (and only that file) listen in Working Copy Changes
* If I press "double arrow up" (stage all) in the Commit window, this single file is moved.to stage
* If I then commit, this single file is committed.

I have read a post with similar issues: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/164160/working-copy-changes-issue
fields.summary: All files in each repos are listed as "unmodified" in "Working Copy Changes"

fields.description:
Diff view with long lines sometimes is not very usable with large hunks, 'cause it is impossible to see all line without:
1. scroll down to end of hunk
2. scroll right;
3. scroll up to insterested line.
Screenshot attached.
It will be probably better if diffview will have one horizontal scroll for all hunks.
fields.summary: Diff view: avoid vertical scrolling to perform horizontal scrolling

fields.description:
I've modified my system-wide default font sizes to be larger than usual. This generally works very well indeed in SourceTree, but this one element is cut off vertically.

Screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Text cut off vertically in the "Staged files" and "Unstaged files" headings

fields.description:
When doing an interactive add on the command line you can break up hunks down to a single line so that you can stage them.

GIT GUI also has a right click action that will allow you also stage a single line.

Even when selecting 1 as the context value in  SourceTree I can't get this behavior.
fields.summary: Stage Single Line (Hunk)

fields.description:
Generally, the top line of the commit history list is important.  This is the line where "Uncommitted changes" would appear when appropriate.
It would be nice if SourceTree attempted to keep the top line in view (not scrolled off the top) when this is possible.
fields.summary: Try to ensure top line of history is in view

fields.description:
In addition to $REPO, $FILE and $SHA it'd be really useful if there was a parameter of $MESS (for commit message) available. 
We have certain things we want to pull out of the commit message to act on and it's impractical to go from the hash, to the repo, to the commit message to these actions.
Thanks
fields.summary: Make the commit message available as a parameter for Custom Actions
Major work to comply with regulatory legislation

fields.description: Edited in russian commit message after interactive rebase is corrupted: rendered as a sequence of "?".
fields.summary: Commit message text corruption after interactive rebase

fields.description:
Setup wizard just after the installation. I select a folder (nonempty). Receive message: "The destination path ... already exists and is not an empty folder. Please choose an empty or new folder into which to clone."
I delete the folder and then recreate it.
Choose it again.
I receive the same message but I'm sure the folder is empty now.
fields.summary: Cannot clone into a non-empty folder
commit with files and folders with | (pipe) from linux block sourcetree from win
French Translation issues

fields.description:
In the "Clone / Add / Create Repository" dialogue there is "Author Map File" field when the "Source Path / Url" is SVN repo. Next to this field is button opening dialogue for select this file. 

Issue: This dialogue wants open folder instead of file
fields.summary: Clone SVN: Autor map file field button opens dialog for selecting folder instead selecting file

fields.description:
When git's comment character is changed SourceTree's interactive rebase shows parts of the comments as commits; if these are not deleted before continuing the rebase fails.

It appears that SourceTree no longer recognises the comments with the new character.

Steps to reproduce:
# Change the comment character config setting (core.commentchar) in git. (';' used in testing)
# Start an interactive rebase

Current workaround:
Delete the lines that are not real commits when setting up the rebase.
fields.summary: Interactive rebase doesn't respect "core.commentchar" config
